title: So You Want to Work at Riot Games?

embed.description: Riot is #13 on Fortune's Best Companies to Work For list, that means it must be amazing to work at Riot, right? Original Reddit Post Text: http://gnarbagies.tumblr.com/post/113128136224/working-at-riot-games-or-why-riot-cant-get-shit Modified Reddit Post: http://www.reddit.com/r/leagueoflegends/comments/20ivqv/the_hard_realities_of_working_at_riot_games/?limit=500 Riot #13 on Fortune: http://fortune.com/best-companies/riot-games-13/ GreatRated review of Riot Games: http://us.greatrated.com/riot-games Thumbnail Gnar: http://drweesnaw.deviantart.com/art/Pixel-Gnar-505441309

I believe this kind of decision making about "what do you wanna do? where do you want to work? which path should I take?" always have a risk, I don't think riot games is the only company with many cons, the thing is that most people that have made the decision to work in Riot Games are content and satisfied. Now go and do surveys about how is working in other companies and you'll find out that Riot Games isn't that bad. Just my opinion and such
